Selected Answer: B
Two Cisco IMP Servers per location

Selected Answer: B
IMP does support centralized Deployments, but the question states "resilience is important"
The Recommended Deployment is "Deploy a pair of IM and Presence Service servers in a cluster configuration"
https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/td/docs/solutions/PA/overview/15x/clbpa15x.pdf

Recommandation should be to have two IMPs in each location.
Therefore the answer is either B or C - I would choose B, because it clearly states "two Cisco IMP Servers per location"

choices.C: Expand the Cisco UCM cluster with Cisco IM and Presence nodes in each location.
choices.A: Configure IMP functionality in Cisco UCM with failover. Cisco IM and Presence servers are not needed from systems release 14.X and newer.
choices.B: Deploy a minimum of two Cisco IMP servers per location, with one publisher and one subscriber connected to the existing local cluster.
choices.D: Deploy a central Cisco IM and Presence server at one central location because users will log in to Cisco UCM in case of a failover.

questions.question_text: An organization wants to run on-premises instant messaging (IM), and resilience is important because this is a business-critical application for them. The organization has three locations with Cisco UCM clusters in each location. Which additional configuration is needed to meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I guess they are looking for B
"Troubleshooting Topics
You cannot start the XCP XMPP Federation Connection Manager service on the IM and Presence Service node, unless you turn on XMPP Federation on the node."
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/im_presence/interdomain_federation/12_5_1/cup0_b_interdomain-federation-1251su3/cup0_b_interdomain-federation-1251su3_chapter_01101.html#CUP0_TK_T17CFBAA_00

choices.C: Restart the Cisco XCP Router service.
choices.A: Restart the Cisco IM and Presence service.
choices.D: Enable TLS in the XMPP Federation settings.

questions.question_text: An engineer must configure XMPP federation on a Cisco Instant Messaging and Presence Service node, but the XCP XMPP Federation Connection Manager vice fails to start. Which action must the engineer take to resolve the issue?

choices.D: Add restriction table patterns to match applicable trunk access codes for both phone system integrations.
choices.C: Set up all restriction tables to block calls to the international operator.
choices.B: Restrict the numbers that can be used for system transfers.
choices.A: Set up restriction tables to block all calls to international numbers.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Seems to be D

questions.question_text: An engineer is configuring toll fraud prevention on a Cisco Unity Connection system. The Unity Connection system is integrated with two phone systems, each with its own trunk access code. Which configuration blocks attempts to bypass the restriction table by dialing trunk access codes?
